restartText: You've been blown to pieces! Want to try the level again?

text.text: So, you made it across the moat. Figures. Well, welcome to the inside of my tower.

replies.text: Where is the thing you stole from me?

text.text: Ah, quick and to the point. You will have to face my guardian first, though. It's the statue in the middle of the room.

replies.text: You said the moat was your last line of defense.

text.text: Thank you. I've found a minimalist open design can do wonders with the feel of a space.
What do you think of the statue in the center of the floor?
text.reply: Isn't that the same one as from your statuary garden?

text.text: Yes, but with one special difference. I've adjusted this one to be my guardian.
text.reply: You said the moat was your last line of defense.

text.text: I lied. I am still a villain, after all.
text.reply: Ok, so how does this statue act as your guardian?

text.text: It moves around, blocking your access to defusing certain spaces. It only moves when you reveal a tile and it always moves if it can.
text.reply: Does it move in any particular direction?

text.text: Yes, it will always move toward where you clicked, although it can only move one square at a time, and never diagonally.
text.reply: Well, I suppose I can work around that.

text.text: You will have to because if you let it get too close, you are doomed!
If, when it moves, my guardian lands on the spot you just clicked, then it will explode all the bombs!
And I have some super bombs too. No moving bombs, though. They are bad for the linoleum.
text.reply: Bombs with yellow squares, too. Got it.

text.text: So to summarize: the statue will move toward you when you click on an unknown space. If it moves onto that space, you are blown up. It only moves a space at a time, so you just need to keep away.
